columns.text: In this problem, we will be dealing with the accounting break-even point.

There are different types of break-even points, financial, cash, and accounting. For the accounting break-even point, this is the number of sales required for the revenue of the company to equal the initial investment and fixed costs.

Multiply both sides by $\$9$ to remove the denominator

$$\begin{aligned}
125.736 \times \$9 &=\$820,000+\text{D}\\[15 pt]
\$1,131,624&=\$820,000+\text{D}\\[15 pt]
\text{D}&=\$311,624
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation is $\$311,624$.

Cross multiply the given to remove the values in the denominator then distribute the terms.

$$\begin{aligned}
165,000\times(\text{P}-\$27)&=\$2,320,000+\$975,000\\[15 pt]
165,000\text{P}-\$4,455,000&=\$3,295,000
\end{aligned}$$

Isolate the term with the variable then divide both sides by $165,000$

$$\begin{aligned}
165,000\text{P}&=\$3,295,000+\$4,455,000\\[15 pt]
165,000\text{P}&=\$7,750,000\\[15 pt]
\text{P}&=\dfrac{\$7,750,000}{165,000}\\[15 pt]
\text{P}&=\$46.97
\end{aligned}$$

The price per unit is $\$46.97$.

Cross-multiply the given terms to remove the denominator:

$$\begin{aligned}
21,430\times(\$92-\text{v})&=\$237,000-\$128,700\\[15 pt]
\$1,971,560-21,430\text{v}&=\$108,300
\end{aligned}$$

Isolate the term with the variable and divide both sides by $21,430$

$$\begin{aligned}
21,430\text{v}&=\$1,971,560-\$108,300\\[15 pt]
21,430\text{v}&=\$1,863,260\\[15 pt]
\text{v}&=\dfrac{\$1,863,260}{21,430}\\[15 pt]
\text{v}&=\$86.95
\end{aligned}$$

The variable price per unit is $\$86.95$.
